title: Swift 3 wrapper around c interface.
body_html:
From comments here @rxwei
#19

It's apparent that the c wrapper is limited - and there's no feature parity matching python api.
In order to progress swift - we need more of the python functionality to be ported to c interface.
Or a path forward using the services layer.

I wonder if this c porting could be done automagically using some off the shelf library?
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4650243/convert-python-program-to-c-c-code

body:
From comments here @rxwei
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/19

It's apparent that the c wrapper is limited - and there's no feature parity matching python api. 
In order to progress swift - we need more of the python functionality to be ported to c interface.
Or a path forward using the services layer. 

I wonder if this c porting could be done automagically using some off the shelf library?
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4650243/convert-python-program-to-c-c-code
